rules.comments: The behaviors in the Default Rule apply to all requests for the property hostname(s) unless another rule overrides the Default Rule settings.

children.name: Clickjack Prevention
children.comments: The X-Frame-Options HTTP response header can be used to indicate whether or not a browser should be allowed to render a page in a <frame> or <iframe>. Sites can use this to avoid clickjacking attacks, by ensuring that their content is not embedded into other sites.

children.name: XSS Prevention
children.comments: The X-Frame-Options HTTP response header can be used to indicate whether or not a browser should be allowed to render a page in a <frame> or <iframe>. Sites can use this to avoid clickjacking attacks, by ensuring that their content is not embedded into other sites.

children.name: Config Manager Legacy: Disable LMA for Old Browsers
children.comments: Replicates Config Manager's 'Last Mile Acceleration': 'Disable for Old Browsers' logic. Config Manger's description: 'Do not use Last Mile Acceleration for the following browsers: MSIE 4, MSIE 5( Mac), and all Mozilla 4. These older browsers incorrectly advertise they support gzip compression.'

children.name: Old IE browsers
children.comments: Disables last mile compression for old Internet Explorer browsers

children.name: Old Mozilla browsers
children.comments: Disables last mile compression for old Mozilla browsers

options.xml:
<assign:variable>
    <name>CC_CHECK</name>
    <value>on</value>
</assign:variable>
<match:request.method value="AKAMAI_PURGE AKAMAI_TRANSLATE">
    <assign:variable>
        <name>CC_CHECK</name>
        <value>off</value>
    </assign:variable>
</match:request.method>
<match:client.ip2 value="127.0.0.1" check-ips="connecting">
    <assign:variable>
        <name>CC_CHECK</name>
        <value>off</value>
    </assign:variable>
</match:client.ip2>
<match:variable name="CC_CHECK" value="on">
    <match:request.type value="CLIENT_REQ">
        <assign:extract-value>
            <location>Client_Certificate</location>
            <location-id>status_msg</location-id>
            <variable-name>CC_STATUS_MSG</variable-name>
        </assign:extract-value>
        <match:variable name="CC_STATUS_MSG" value="missing" result="false">
            <assign:extract-value>
                <location>Client_Certificate</location>
                <location-id>issuer_dn</location-id>
                <variable-name>CC_ISSUER</variable-name>
            </assign:extract-value>
            <edgeservices:modify-outgoing-request.add-header>
                <name>x-rh-certauth-issuer</name>
                <status>on</status>
                <value>%(CC_ISSUER)</value>
            </edgeservices:modify-outgoing-request.add-header>
            <assign:extract-value>
                <location>Client_Certificate</location>
                <location-id>subject_dn</location-id>
                <variable-name>CC_CN</variable-name>
            </assign:extract-value>
            <edgeservices:modify-outgoing-request.add-header>
                <name>x-rh-certauth-cn</name>
                <status>on</status>
                <value>%(CC_CN)</value>
            </edgeservices:modify-outgoing-request.add-header>
            <edgeservices:modify-outgoing-request.add-header>
                <name>x-rh-certauth-host</name>
                <status>on</status>
                <value>cloud.redhat.com</value>
            </edgeservices:modify-outgoing-request.add-header>
        </match:variable>
    </match:request.type>
</match:variable>

<assign:variable>
        <name>NL</name>
        <value><br></value>
    </assign:variable>
    <assign:variable>
        <name>B</name>
        <value><b></value>
    </assign:variable>
    <assign:variable>
        <name>BE</name>
        <value></b></value>
    </assign:variable>
    <assign:extract-value>
        <location>Client_Request_Header</location>
        <location-id>Cookie</location-id>
        <variable-name>COOKIE_VALUE</variable-name>
    </assign:extract-value>
    <assign:variable>
        <name>AKA_TEST_BODY</name>
        <value><h1>Akamai Test Page</h1>%(NL)%(NL)%(B)CC STATUS:%(BE) %(CC_STATUS)%(NL)%(NL)%(B)CERTIFICATE INFORMATION:%(BE)%(NL)%(B)CC_PROBLEM:%(BE) %(CC_PROBLEM)%(NL)%(B)error:%(BE) %(CC_STATUS_MSG)%(NL)%(B)serial:%(BE)%(CC_SERIAL)%(NL)%(B)issuer:%(BE)%(CC_ISSUER_DN)%(NL)%(B)subject:%(BE)%(CC_SUBJECT_DN)%(NL)%(NL)%(B)CCC INFORMATION:%(BE)%(NL)%(B)ccc_valid:%(BE)%(IS_CCC_VALID)%(NL)%(B)ccc_ip:%(BE)%(PASSED_CCC_IP)%(NL)%(B)ccc_exp:%(BE)%(PASSED_CCC_EXPIRE_TIME)%(NL)%(B)ccc_serial:%(BE)%(CCC_SERIAL)%(NL)%(B)ccc_issuer:%(BE)%(CCC_ISSUER)%(NL)%(B)ccc_subject:%(BE)%(CCC_SUBJECT)%(NL)%(NL)%(B)CLIENT IP:%(BE) %(AK_CLIENT_IP)%(NL)%(B)EDGE SERVER IP:%(BE) %(AK_GHOST_IP)%(NL)%(B)Epoch Time:%(BE) %(AK_CURRENT_TIME)%(NL)%(B)CPCODE:%(BE) %(AK_CPCODE)%(NL)%(NL)%(B)COOKIES:%(BE) %(CC_PEM)</value>
    </assign:variable>
    <match:variable name="FORWARD_ORIGIN">
        <assign:variable>
            <name>AKA_TEST_BODY</name>
            <value>%(AKA_TEST_BODY)%(NL)%(NL)%(B)FORWARD ORIGIN: %(BE)%(FORWARD_ORIGIN)%(NL)</value>
        </assign:variable>
    </match:variable>
    <!-- Logic to build the Response Body -->
    <edgeservices:construct-response>
        <status>on</status>
        <http-status>200</http-status>
        <body>%(AKA_TEST_BODY)</body>
        <force-cache-eviction>on</force-cache-eviction>
    </edgeservices:construct-response>

rules.name: default
